poem:
Title: "Devon's Thirst Quenched"

In the quiescence of Devon's morn,
Tap-water whispering again, newborn.
Parasite's reign, overthrown, outworn;
A communal sigh, relief adorned.

Tender is the turn of the spout,
In Alston's homes, where drought did flout.
Yet, in the upper cliffs of Brixham,
Still, they wait for purity's anthem.

Cautious drops in Kingswear's stead,
In the gentle acquiescence of dread.
